Summary of a cats object

Source: R/summary.cats.R
summary.cats.Rd

Summary of a cats object

Usage

# S3 method for cats
summary(object, ...)

Arguments

object

a cats object

...

Dynamic parameter for the values of additional parameters for the print method

See also

cats

Examples

x <- cats()
summary(x)
#> Options 
#>                   chosen
#> freq            5.00e-01
#> freq2          -1.00e+00
#> ncases          5.00e+02
#> ncontrols       5.00e+02
#> ncases2         5.00e+02
#> ncontrols2      5.00e+02
#> risk            1.50e+00
#> risk2          -1.00e+00
#> pisamples      -1.00e+00
#> prevalence      1.00e-01
#> prevalence2    -1.00e+00
#> additive        0.00e+00
#> recessive       0.00e+00
#> dominant        0.00e+00
#> multiplicative  1.00e+00
#> alpha           1.00e-07
#> pimarkers       3.16e-03

#>      
#> 
#>         One stage Design = 5.326724
#>        Stage 1 Threshold = 2.951729
#>    Replication Threshold = 4.000192
#> Joint Analysis Threshold = 5.30794
#> 
#> Eobjectpected disesase allele frequencies
#>      
#> 
#>     Cases in stage 1 = 0.6
#> Controls in stage 1  = 0.4888889

#>  Controls in stage 2 = 0.4888889

#>      
#> 
#>                    For a one-stage study = 0.962
#>       For first stage in two-stage study = 0.981
